channel.title: DevHawk tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from DevHawk.

item.description: Building on Windows for test purposes. Luckily, it's a small repo and I'm not in a rush. https://t.co/BVtmJ76Xkk

My son Patrick skated several summer camps + teams with Vaughan over the years. Vaughan even tapped me to help him coach one summer (a mistake he only made once ðŸ¤£) Congrats on an amazing career Vaughan. https://t.co/VmwPuJoS4s
This time, I'm actually doing a contract tutorial instead of a tour of the Blockchain Toolkit https://t.co/x7p1Xtk8Dd

TFW you waste most of your day on what turns out to be a known @dotnet issue that was closed as won't fix 8 months ago "to reflect current priorities" but the docs still tell developers to do things the way that is known to be broken. https://t.co/dyMt3HVOQa https://t.co/KcZu0i1zv5
That is a very very very old business card in that luggage tag https://t.co/OIjIbrTf6t

item.title: EverythingEverywhereAllAtOnce is one of the best movies I've ever seen.
item.description: The last movie to hit me like this was the Matrix. This actually hit me harder. Some of that is subject matter + where I am in my life. But a lot of it is just how fucking good the movie is

FYI, this workshop was not a c# contract tutorial. More of a tour of lesser known features of the Neo Blockchain Toolkit. Happy to do a c# contract tutorial workshop if there is interest. https://t.co/8Xkt0qG0ld
There are more @Neo_Blockchain technical workshops. Next one starts shortly. Focused on developing smart contracts with Python featuring @lllwvlvwlll https://t.co/K6D0AZpc0q

FYI I'm talking about @Neo_Blockchain Smart Contract Development *FOR* an hour, not *IN* an hour. The workshop is *TOMORROW* (aka April 4th) at 2pm UTC. My hockey team won tonight & I had the primary assist on the game winning goal. I will be tired, but in a very good mood. ðŸ¤ª https://t.co/eiJcxKDhF7

Holy shit @pagliaccipizza in Sammamish has awful customer service. Apparently nobody here can tell time. "its going to be 8 minutes" 20 minutes later, was still waiting. Wouldn't bother me so much if we weren't in a hurry to youngest child performance.
